p: Among the 45 sub-typed HBV-D cases, sub-genotype D3 was the most abundant (25 and 13 cases in the 1978–79 and the 1994–95 groups, respectively) and allowed for sub-genotype specific analysis. As reported in Table 2, BCP/pre-core mutations in HBV-D3 sequences were detected in 2/25 (8%) cases in the 1978–79 group vs. 6/13 (46%) cases in the 1994–95 group ( p = 0.011).
